abstract.text: A programmatic interface for objects that represent a telephony action associated with a call object.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The CallKit framework provides the following concrete
Places a call on hold or removes a call from hold.
Groups a call with another call or removes a call from a group.
Plays a DTMF (dual tone multifrequency) tone sequence on a call.
To perform one or more actions, you add them to a new
object and pass the transaction to an instance of
method. After each action is performed by the telephony provider, the provider’s delegate calls either the
method, indicating that the action was successfully performed, or the
method, to indicate that an error occurred; both of these methods set the

abstract.text: Display the system-calling UI for your app’s VoIP services, and coordinate your calling services with other apps and the system.
An abstract class that declares a programmatic interface for objects that represent a telephony action.
An encapsulation of the act of answering an incoming call.
A programmatic interface for objects that represent a telephony action associated with a call object.
The unique identifier for the call associated with the action.
Initializes a new action for a call identified by a given UUID.
Creates a new action for a call with data in an unarchiver.
A programmatic interface for interacting with and observing calls.
Requests that the actions in the specified transaction be asynchronously performed by the telephony provider.
An encapsulation of the act of ending a call.
An encapsulation of the act of playing a dual tone multifrequency (DTMF) sequence.
An encapsulation of the act of grouping or ungrouping calls.
An encapsulation of the act of placing a call on hold or removing a call from hold.
An encapsulation of the act of muting or unmuting a call.
An encapsulation of the act of initiating an outgoing call.
An object that contains zero or more action objects for a call controller to perform.
A true value.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
